name: dependabot
description: Automatically update dependencies and vulnerabilities in your code
author: Tingle Software

inputs.name: useConfigFile
inputs.label: Use Custom Dependabot YAML File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Determines if the task will pick config values specified from the yaml file located at `.azuredevops/dependabot.yml`

inputs.name: packageManager
inputs.label: Package Ecosystem
inputs.helpMarkDown: The package ecosystem to check updates for. Learn more [here](https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/administering-a-repository/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#package-ecosystem).

inputs.name: directory
inputs.label: Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the directory from where Dependabot should check for updates. Examples: `/` for root, `/src` for src folder.

inputs.name: targetBranch
inputs.label: Target Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: The branch to be targeted when creating pull requests. When not specified, Dependabot will resolve the default branch of the repository. Examples: `master`, `main`, `develop`

inputs.name: openPullRequestsLimit
inputs.label: Limit number of open pull requests for version updates.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum number of open pull requests to have at any one time. Defaults to 5.

inputs.name: versioningStrategy
inputs.label: Versioning Strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: The versioning strategy to use. Learn more [here](https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/administering-a-repository/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#versioning-strategy).

inputs.name: failOnException
inputs.label: Determines if the execution should fail when an exception occurs. Defaults to `true`
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to true, a failure in updating a single dependency will cause the container execution to fail thereby causing the task to fail. This is important when you want a single failure to prevent trying to update other dependencies.

inputs.name: autoApprove
inputs.label: Determines if the pull requests that dependabot creates should be automatically approved.
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to `true`, pull requests will automatically be approved by the specified user.

inputs.name: azureAutoAproveUserEmail
inputs.label: The email of the user that should approve the PR.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The email of the user of that shall be used to approve the created PR automatically.

inputs.name: azureAutoApproveToken
inputs.label: A personal access token of the user that should approve the PR.
inputs.helpMarkDown: A personal access token of the user of that shall be used to approve the created PR automatically. The token must belong to the user which was specified by email. If the same user that creates the PR should approve, this can be left empty. This won't work with if the Build Service with the build service account!

inputs.name: setAutoComplete
inputs.label: Determines if the pull requests that dependabot creates should have auto complete set.
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set to `true`, pull requests that pass all policies will be merged automatically.

inputs.name: gitHubConnection
inputs.label: GitHub connection (OAuth or PAT)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the GitHub service connection to use to connect to the GitHub repositories. The connection must be based on a GitHub user's OAuth or a GitHub personal access token. Learn more about service connections [here](https://aka.ms/AA3am5s).

inputs.name: azureDevOpsAccessToken
inputs.label: Azure DevOps Personal Access Token.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Personal Access Token for accessing Azure DevOps repositories. Supply a value here to avoid using permissions for the Build Service either because you cannot change its permissions or because you prefer that the Pull Requests be done by a different user.

inputs.name: targetRepositoryName
inputs.label: Target Repository Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the repository to target for processing. If this value is not supplied then the Build Repository Name is used. Supplying this value allows creation of a single pipeline that runs Dependablot against multiple repositories.

inputs.name: excludeRequirementsToUnlock
inputs.label: Space-separated list of dependency updates requirements to be excluded.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Exclude certain dependency updates requirements. See list of allowed values [here](https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/600#issuecomment-407808103). Useful if you have lots of dependencies and the update script too slow. The values provided are space-separated. Example: `own all` to only use the `none` version requirement.

inputs.name: workItemId
inputs.label: Work item identifier to be linked to the Pull Requests.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The identifier of the work item to be linked to the Pull Requests that dependabot creates.
